description:
'''Toytown techno''' (also known as '''kiddy rave''' or '''cartoon rave''') is an underground subgenre of [[techno]] that emerged in the early 1990s, characterized by merging techno, [[Jungle music|jungle]], or [[breakbeat hardcore]] with [[Sampling (music)|samples]] from [[children's television series]] or [[public information films]]. 

Popular songs within the subgenre include [[Alpha Team_(band)|Alpha Team]]'s "Speed", [[Mark Summers]]' "Summers Magic", [[Luna-C|Smart E's]] "[[Sesame's Treet]]", [[the Prodigy]]'s "[[Charly (song)|Charly]]", [[Shaft (rave group)|Shaft]]'s "Roobarb and Custard", and [[Urban Hype]]'s "[[A Trip to Trumpton]]", which featured samples from ''[[Speed Racer]]'', ''[[The Magic Roundabout]]'', ''[[Sesame Street]]'', ''[[Charley Says]]'', ''[[Roobarb]]'', and ''[[Trumpton]]'', respectively.
